KeyframeProperty

method
Rekapi.KeyframeProperty()
  • @param: {number}millisecondWhere on the animation timeline this KeyframeProperty is.
  • @param: {string}nameThe property's name, such as "x" or "opacity."
  • @param: {number,string}valueThe value that this KeyframeProperty represents.
  • @param: {string=}opt_easingThe easing curve at which this KeyframeProperty should be animated to. Defaults to "linear".
  • @constructor:

Description

Represents an individual component of an actor's keyframe state. In most cases you won't need to deal with this object directly, as the Rekapi.Actor APIs abstract a lot of what this Object does away for you.

Source

Rekapi.KeyframeProperty = function (millisecond, name, value, opt_easing) {
    this.id = _.uniqueId('keyframeProperty_');
    this.millisecond = millisecond;
    this.name = name;
    this.value = value;
    this.easing = opt_easing || DEFAULT_EASING;
    this.nextProperty = null;

    return this;
  };
  var KeyframeProperty = Rekapi.KeyframeProperty;

modifyWith

method
KeyframeProperty.prototype.modifyWith()
  • @param: {Object}newProperties

Description

Modify a Rekapi.KeyframeProperty. Any of the following are valid properties of newProperties and correspond to the parameters of the Rekapi.KeyframeProperty constructor:

  • millisecond (number)
  • name (string)
  • value (number|string)
  • easing (string)

Source

KeyframeProperty.prototype.modifyWith = function (newProperties) {
    var modifiedProperties = {};

    _.each(['millisecond', 'easing', 'value'], function (str) {
      modifiedProperties[str] = typeof(newProperties[str]) === 'undefined' ?
          this[str] : newProperties[str];
    }, this);

    _.extend(this, modifiedProperties);
  };

getValueAt

method
KeyframeProperty.prototype.getValueAt()
  • @param: {number}millisecondThe millisecond in the animation timeline to compute the state value for.
  • @return: {number}

Description

Calculate the midpoint between this Rekapi.KeyframeProperty and the next Rekapi.KeyframeProperty in a actor's property track.

In just about all cases, millisecond should be between this Rekapi.KeyframeProperty's millisecond and the millisecond of the Rekapi.KeyframeProperty that follows it in the animation timeline, but it is valid to specify a value outside of this range.

Source

KeyframeProperty.prototype.getValueAt = function (millisecond) {
    var fromObj = {};
    var toObj = {};
    var value;
    var nextProperty = this.nextProperty;
    var correctedMillisecond = Math.max(millisecond, this.millisecond);

    if (nextProperty) {
      correctedMillisecond =
          Math.min(correctedMillisecond, nextProperty.millisecond);

      fromObj[this.name] = this.value;
      toObj[this.name] = nextProperty.value;

      var delta = nextProperty.millisecond - this.millisecond;
      var interpolatedPosition =
          (correctedMillisecond - this.millisecond) / delta;

      value = interpolate(fromObj, toObj, interpolatedPosition,
          nextProperty.easing)[this.name];
    } else {
      value = this.value;
    }

    return value;
  };

linkToNext

method
KeyframeProperty.prototype.linkToNext()
  • @param: {Rekapi.KeyframeProperty}nextPropertyThe KeyframeProperty that should immediately follow this one on the animation timeline.

Description

Create the reference to the Rekapi.KeyframeProperty that follows this one on an actor's property track. Property tracks are just linked lists of Rekapi.KeyframePropertys.

Source

KeyframeProperty.prototype.linkToNext = function (nextProperty) {
    this.nextProperty = nextProperty || null;
  };

detach

method
KeyframeProperty.prototype.detach()
  • @return: {Rekapi.KeyframeProperty}

Description

Disassociates this Rekapi.KeyframeProperty from its Rekapi.Actor, if it has one. This is called automatically by various Rekapi.Actor methods and triggers the removeKeyframeProperty event on the associated Rekapi instance, if there is one.

Source

KeyframeProperty.prototype.detach = function () {
    var actor = this.actor;
    if (actor) {
      if (actor.rekapi) {
        fireEvent(actor.rekapi, 'removeKeyframeProperty', _, this);
        delete actor._keyframeProperties[this.id];
        this.actor = null;
      }
    }

    return this;
  };

exportPropertyData

method
KeyframeProperty.prototype.exportPropertyData()
  • @return: {Object}

Description

Export a serializable Object of this Rekapi.KeyframeProperty's state data.

Example

Source

KeyframeProperty.prototype.exportPropertyData = function () {
    return {
     'millisecond': this.millisecond
     ,'name': this.name
     ,'value': this.value
     ,'easing': this.easing
    };
  };

});
